1.name: What is sKZT?
1.answer: sKZT is a stablecoin pegged to the rate of 1 Kazakhstani tenge (KZT). It is backed by reserves in fiat currency (KZT) and issued under regulatory supervision within the 'regulatory sandbox'.

2.name: How is sKZT different from other cryptocurrencies?
2.answer:
• Stability: sKZT is always pegged 1:1 to the Kazakhstani tenge (KZT), eliminating typical cryptocurrency volatility.
  • Regulation: sKZT operates under the oversight of the National Bank of Kazakhstan.
  • Transparency: Every issued stablecoin is 100% backed by reserves, verified through regular audits.

3.name: Where can I buy or sell sKZT?
3.answer: You can purchase and sell sKZT through the official online wallet on sanaly.kz. To do this, simply register and use the convenient online wallet interface.

4.name: What is required for registration in the online wallet?
4.answer: To create an online wallet, you will need to present an identity document and pass a liveness test (verification that a live person is in front of the camera).

5.name: Can sKZT be exchanged back to tenge?
5.answer: Yes, at any time you can exchange 1 sKZT = 1 KZT through an online wallet if you are a resident of the RK with an active bank account in Halyk Bank.

6.name: How is the 1:1 exchange rate stability ensured?
6.answer: Each sKZT is backed by real tenge in accounts at regulated banks. The issuing company, Sanaly Systems, regularly publishes reports confirming 100% reserve backing.

7.name: How can I be sure of the issuer's reliability?
7.answer: Sanaly Systems is supervised by the National Bank of Kazakhstan, ensuring full regulatory compliance. The company undergoes regular audits and publishes public reports on reserves, minimizing risks and guaranteeing transparency.

8.name: Which blockchain does sKZT operate on?
8.answer: sKZT operates on the Ethereum blockchain, ensuring a high level of security and transparency for all transactions.

9.name: Can I transfer sKZT to another wallet?
9.answer: Yes, sKZT supports transfers to any ERC-20 compatible wallets (e.g., MetaMask, Trust Wallet, etc.).

10.name: What if I accidentally send sKZT to the wrong address?
10.answer: Unfortunately, blockchain transactions are irreversible. We recommend always double-check the recipient’s address before confirming any transfer to avoid mistakes.

11.name: How long will the first wave of sKZT usage last?
11.answer: The first wave will run until March 31, 2026. After its successful completion, we plan to expand the user base and introduce new features. Follow updates on our website.

12.name: What operations are available in the online wallet?
12.answer:
All registered users have access to the functionality of depositing sKZT / USDT from an external wallet, withdrawing sKZT / USDT to an external wallet, exchanging sKZT for USDT and vice versa, transferring sKZT / USDT to other users' wallets.

For residents of Kazakhstan who have an account with Halyk Bank, the functionality of buying sKZT for KZT and selling sKZT back in exchange for KZT is additionally available.
